information: You can customize the types of properties you use to cut cards (e.g. URL, publication, title, etc.) using Settings > Customize Properties List.

Want to add your initials to your cites? Not a fan of the current cite style?

Check out Settings > Card And Cite Format Settings! You can tweak every aspect of the card generation process to your heart's desire.
You can send your cards directly to Microsoft Word/Verbatim using the Send to Word feature. Check it out in the Tools > Export Card panel.
You can highlight and underline your card within Cardr, without having to export it to Word first. Check this out in the Tools > Edit Card panel.
Scanning text from a book or a PDF? You can use Cardr's handy OCR tool to scan multiple regions of text into a single card.
Up doing some late-night research? Check out Night Mode (Settings > Night Mode) to give your eyes a break.

If you highlight the section of the article you want to use in Google Chrome before selecting Cardr, only that section will be used to create the card. A similar effect can be achieved through Tools > Keep Only Selected Text.
Want to get rid of certain sections of an article, or only keep a certain paragraph? Use the Tools > Add & Remove Text panel to modify a card's content.
You can customize the highlight color and highlight/underline shortcuts in Settings > Highlight & underline settings.
Need to copy a card to a Google Doc or an email? Simply use Tools > Export > Copy to copy the card to your clipboard.
You can customize and tweak many features of the card display using the Settings menu and even change the formatting of the card & cite.
